meanings.definition: Saroses (noun): plural form of saros, a period of approximately 18 years 11 days 8 hours (or 223 synodic months), after which the Sun, Earth, and Moon return to approximately the same relative geometry.
meanings.sent1: Every saroses, the celestial bodies align in a unique way.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the saroses to understand the cosmic patterns.
meanings.sent3: During the saroses, the sky seems to play a game of hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: The saroses dance of the planets is like a cosmic ballet.
meanings.sent5: The saroses mark a celestial reunion that mesmerizes astronomers.

meanings.definition: Saroses (verb): third person singular present of saros, to undergo a cycle of approximately 18 years 11 days 8 hours.
meanings.sent1: He saroses every couple of decades, following the cosmic rhythm.
meanings.sent2: The Earth saroses predictably, like clockwork in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The planets saroses in a celestial waltz around the Sun.
meanings.sent4: Time saroses forward, never looking back.
meanings.sent5: The universe saroses in an eternal dance of motion and change.
